meanings.definition: To utter a loud, raucous cry or shout.
meanings.sent1: The little boy would yaup with joy when he saw his favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: The crowd began to yaup in excitement as the band took the stage.
meanings.sent3: The parrot decided to yaup along with the noisy children in the park.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm seemed to yaup angrily as it rolled in.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock's loud yaup woke up the entire household.
meanings.sent6: She didn't mean to yaup so loudly during the movie.
meanings.sent7: The cat started to yaup when it saw a mouse scurrying by.
meanings.sent8: The baby's constant yauping kept the parents up all night.
meanings.sent9: The old car engine began to yaup and sputter as it struggled to start.
meanings.sent10: The teacher had to ask the students to stop yauping during class.

meanings.definition: A loud, raucous cry or shout.
meanings.sent1: The forest was filled with the yaup of wild animals at night.
meanings.sent2: The sudden yaup from the attic startled everyone in the house.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's yaup of laughter echoed through the theater.
meanings.sent4: The warrior's yaup of victory could be heard across the battlefield.
meanings.sent5: The baby's hungry yaup signaled it was time for a feeding.
meanings.sent6: The unexpected yaup from the basement made everyone jump.
meanings.sent7: The opera singer's powerful yaup resonated through the concert hall.
meanings.sent8: The haunted house was filled with eerie yaups in the dead of night.
meanings.sent9: The referee's sharp yaup signaled the end of the match.
meanings.sent10: The sudden yaup of the fire alarm sent everyone into a panic.
